meanings.definition: A heavy blow with the hand or a blunt object.
meanings.sent1: He felt a thump on his back after his friend playfully hit him.
meanings.sent2: The thump of the hammer echoed through the room.
meanings.sent3: The thump of the basketball hitting the ground made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The thump of the drum signaled the start of the performance.
meanings.sent5: The thump of the falling tree branch startled the hikers.

meanings.definition: A dull, heavy sound, such as that made by a heavy object falling or striking something.
meanings.sent1: The thump of the book hitting the table was loud.
meanings.sent2: She heard a thump coming from the attic late at night.
meanings.sent3: The thump of the pillow hitting the wall was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The thump of the rain on the roof was soothing.
meanings.sent5: The thump of the door closing echoed in the empty house.

meanings.definition: To strike or beat heavily, especially with the fist or a blunt object.
meanings.sent1: He had to thump the nail into the wood with force.
meanings.sent2: The chef began to thump the dough to make bread.
meanings.sent3: She tried to thump the stubborn jar lid open.
meanings.sent4: The boxer aimed to thump his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent5: The drummer continued to thump the drums rhythmically.
